titleStmt.title: Gravestone of Donald Mowbray Waite and Janette Elizabeth Waite

support.p: This is a stone (possibly sandstone) gravestone ( 69 cm 101 cm 10 cm ).

supportDesc.condition: The gravestone is in relatively good condition, all the text is visible and legible, although the grave is cleary dirty and has some moss growing on the top.

layoutDesc.layout: The text is carved into the gravestone. The text is centred within a thin border and the gravestone itself has a simple rectangle shape with a rounded top, although the top corners curve inwards, making it a little decorative.

handDesc.summary: The text varies in size, with the largest letters used for the names, dates and the occupation.
handDesc.handNote: The text is a mixture of capitals, which is used for the names and occupation, and lower case, which is used for other information.

div.p: Donald Mowbray Waite, 1887-1950, architect. True husband, true friend of Janette. Beloved father & brother. And his devoted wife, Janette Elizabeth, 1905-1992.

This twentieth century gravestone lists the names of two occupants, Donald Mowbray Waite and Janette Elizabeth, who we must also assume takes the surname Waite. Donald Mowbray Waite's occupation was that of an architect. This tombstone is different from most of the others in that a birth year and death year are supplied, but no age is give, as well as specific date of birth or death. From the year of birth and death therefore, we can calculate that Donald Mowbray Waite lived to c. 63 years old and Janette Elizabeth lived to c. 87 years old. The grave is located next to the entrance to the Vineyard, an extension to the churchyard at the back, which is largely reserved for more modern graves, as well as a war memorial.
